edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.algorithm.code.macro

Class FetchingMacro

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.algorithm.code.macro.Macro
      • edu.ncsu.csc.Galant.algorithm.code.macro.FetchingMacro

  • public abstract class FetchingMacro
extends Macro

    A macro of the form:
    name variable;

    Fetch and return Node/Edges on the graph. Declare the variable as global and initiliza them inside of algorithm{}.

      • FetchingMacro

        public FetchingMacro(java.lang.String name,
             java.lang.String initializationPrefix)
        Creates a new FetchingMacro. name speclify the name. intilizationPrefix defines the expected variable type. e.g: for macro that gets the number of nodes on the graph, we use "int" as our intilizationPrefix.

      • getVariableName

        public java.lang.String getVariableName(java.lang.String code)
                                 throws MalformedMacroException
        This method returns the variable name as a string. e.g: for macro that gets the number of nodes on the graph, this method would return t if input were numOfNodes t;.
        Parameters:
        code - the code of this macro apply to
        Throws:
        MalformedMacroException - if input is not in the correct pattern or there is no ; at the end of the syntax.

      • modify

        protected final java.lang.String modify(java.lang.String code,
                      java.util.regex.MatchResult match)
                                 throws MalformedMacroException
        Description copied from class: Macro

        Subclasses should implement this method and return a modified version of the current match. The returned string will be used as a replacement string for Matcher.appendReplacement(StringBuffer, String), with the syntax described in the javadoc for that method. So backslashes and dollar signs may need to be escaped.

        If the match is not actually correct, null can be returned. (This can be used with the default applyTo without creating an infinite loop.)

        Note: Macros may add new macros to the end of the macro list (e.g., by creating new macros), but other modifications to the list may not be supported.

        Specified by:
        modify in class Macro
        Parameters:
        code - the user code on which this macro is being applied.
        match - a match of this macro's pattern.
        Returns:
        the replacement of the matched region, or null if the match is not actually valid.
        Throws:
        MalformedMacroException - if the match is not a valid invocation of this macro, but it should have been.
